tmp

Class ModifiedRegExUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • tmp.ModifiedRegExUtils

  • public final class ModifiedRegExUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    The RegExUtils class provides some helper functions to make dealing with regular expressions easier.

    Note that regular expressions passed in as a string are compiled with the Pattern.DOTALL and Pattern.MULTILINE flags set. If this does not fit your needs, use the methods that take a compiled pattern and provide the appropriate pattern object yourself. Furthermore, to improve performance regex strings - once compiled to pattern objects - are cached internally for later re-use.

    Author:
    JÃ¶rg Werner (Xceptance Softare Technologies GmbH)

      • getPattern

        public static java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern(java.lang.String regex)
        Returns the compiled equivalent of the passed regular expression string. This method tries to improve performance by caching the compiled pattern, so subsequent calls with the same regex will return the previously cached pattern. The regex will be compiled with DOTALL and MULTILINE.
        Parameters:
        regex - the regular expression string
        Returns:
        the corresponding pattern object

      • getPattern

        public static java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern(java.lang.String regex,
                                 int flags)
        Returns the compiled equivalent of the passed regular expression string. This method tries to improve performance by caching the compiled pattern, so subsequent calls with the same regex will return the previously cached pattern.
        Parameters:
        regex - the regular expression string
        flags - global flags to be used when compiling the regular expression
        Returns:
        the corresponding pattern object
        Throws:
        java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - if the regular expression is invalid

      • replaceAll

        public static java.lang.String replaceAll(java.lang.String s,
                          java.lang.String regex,
                          java.lang.String replacement)
        Finds all matches for the given regular expression in the given string s and replaces them with the given replacement string. Similar to String.replaceAll(String, String), but the pattern compiled from the regular expression is cached internally.
        Parameters:
        s - the input string
        regex - the regular expression to be matched
        replacement - the replacement string
        Returns:
        the modified input string

      • getCaptureGroupCount

        public static int getCaptureGroupCount(java.lang.String pattern)
        Returns the number of capturing groups defined by the given regular expression.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the regular expression
        Returns:
        number of capturing groups or -1 if passed regular expression is empty (or null)

      • removeAll

        public static java.lang.String removeAll(java.lang.String s,
                         java.lang.String regex)
        Remove all matchings for the given regular expression from the given string. This method makes use of pattern caching.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse
        regex - the regular expression to match
        Returns:
        the process result

      • removeAll

        public static java.lang.String removeAll(java.lang.String s,
                         java.lang.String regex,
                         int group)
        Remove the given group from the regular expression's matching. Note, not the group is removed from the whole string. This method makes use of pattern caching.

        Examples:

        Sample text Regular Expression Group Result Comment
        FooBoo F(o)o 0 Boo Remove completely
        FooBooFooBoo F(o)o 1 FoBooFoBoo 'o' is not removed from complete string but from current matching

        Parameters:
        s - string to parse
        regex - regular expression to match
        group - the regular expression's group to remove from the string
        Returns:
        the process result
